importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the game where the Blue Jays defeated the Mariners, forcing a Game 7 in the ALCS, marking a pivotal moment in the postseason.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeframe covers the conclusion of Game 6 and the start of Game 7 in the ALCS, with the winner advancing to the World Series.

keyTakeAways: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his sixth home run in the postseason, extending the Blue Jays' lead to 5-0 and sealing the Game 6 win.
The Seattle Mariners committed three errors in the second inning, including two consecutive fielding mistakes that led to early runs.
Toronto’s victory forces a decisive Game 7 in the ALCS, the second such game in franchise history and first since 1985.
The Blue Jays will face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series, with Game 1 scheduled for Friday.
Mariners' pitcher Yesevage delivered a strong performance, throwing 31 splitters, striking out seven, and allowing only six hits and three walks.
The Mariners’ season-high three errors significantly impacted the game’s outcome, leading to early scoring and a collapse in momentum.

namedEntities.name: American League Championship Series (ALCS)

namedEntities.name: Yesevage

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Mariners’ pitcher, Yesavage, delivered a strong performance with 31 splitters, seven strikeouts, and minimal runs allowed, showcasing composure and contributing to the Mariners’ defensive collapse.

namedEntities.name: Julio Rodríguez
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He committed a fielding error that allowed Daulton Varsho to advance, contributing to the Mariners' early scoring and defensive breakdown.

namedEntities.name: Eugenio Suárez

namedEntities.name: Daulton Varsho
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He advanced to second base on a fielding error and scored due to subsequent play, helping initiate the Mariners’ scoring in the second inning.

namedEntities.name: Ernie Clement

namedEntities.name: Addison Barger

namedEntities.name: Josh Naylor

namedEntities.name: Randy Arozerana

namedEntities.name: Trey Yesavage

namedEntities.name: Louis Varland

summaryOfNewsArticle: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his sixth postseason home run, helping the Toronto Blue Jays defeat the Seattle Mariners 6-2 and force a decisive Game 7 in the American League Championship Series. The Mariners committed three critical errors in the second inning, including fielding mistakes by Julio Rodríguez and Eugenio Suárez, which allowed early runs and led to a 2-0 and later 4-0 Toronto lead. Despite a late run by Josh Naylor and Randy Arozerana, the Blue Jays' lead was extended by a wild pitch from Matt Brash, sealing the game. The Blue Jays, now in their first Game 7 since 1985, will face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series. The Mariners, who have never played a Game 7, are now eliminated in the playoffs, highlighting the impact of defensive lapses and individual performances.
title: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hits sixth homer of postseason as Blue Jays dominate Mariners to force ALCS Game 7
